name: Lands of the Bohemian Crown
startIntroPart1: O King of all Czechs, Moravian and Silesians. Thou who are the greatest of us Czechs who have ever lived. Holy Roman Emperor. Your whole life is synonym of peace, prosperity and diligence. It was under your hand that our country began to flourish. You built a stone bridge over the Vltava river, who founded a big european university and you, who fed the hungry when building the Hungry wall. There will never be a greater ruler than you.
startIntroPart2: The most beloved of us, benevolent Charles, once again lead our nation to prosperity. Bring our nation to the Roman throne and do not leave us. Raise your bow once more while hunting in your rich forests. After your death, there will no longer be as great ruler as you are. You will remain unforgettable.
declaringWar: Resistance is futile! You cannot hope to stand against the mighty Incan empire. If you will not surrender immediately, then prepare for war!
attacked: Declare war on me?!? You can't, because I declare war on you first!
defeated: How did you darken the sun? I ruled with diligence and mercy—see that you do so as well.
introduction: How are you? You stand before Pachacuti Inca Yupanqui.
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
afterPeace: Viracocha has frowned upon our war, and has agreed to our peace agreements.
tradeRequest: The Incan people offer this fair trade.

name: Loket
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: You fiend! History shall remember this!
